content.raw:
Thanks for your contribution! I just looked at the CI builds, and the only thing that jumped out at me are some whitespace issues, for which I have made inline comments

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64&build=1728)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1728/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1728/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64&build=2533)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/2533/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/2533/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia&build=847)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/847/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/847/

pullrequest.title: fix a bug in Actor.cc when using ActorPlugin where the collision remains at the origin

content.raw:
For your information, I did my testing on ROS Kinetic with Ubuntu 16.04. I came across this issue when I’m using gazebo with a simulated ROS robot that is equipped with Lidar. 

Basically, simply clone this [github repo](https://github.com/richardw05/mybot_ws) to have a simulated robot. 

**Note** please modify this file **mybot\_ws/src/mybot\_description/urdf/mybot.gazebo**. CPU laser must be used since GPU laser is found to be detecting the rendering only instead of the collision boxes.

* from 

    * <sensor type="gpu\_ray" name="head\_hokuyo\_sensor"> to 
    * <sensor type="ray" name="head\_hokuyo\_sensor">
    
* from 

    * <plugin name="gazebo\_ros\_head\_hokuyo\_controller" filename="libgazebo\_ros\_gpu\_laser.so"> to 
    * <plugin name="gazebo\_ros\_head\_hokuyo\_controller" filename="libgazebo\_ros\_laser.so">
    
* Replace the following code block into the **mybot\_ws/src/mybot\_gazebo/worlds/turtlebot\_playground.world**.

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<sdf version="1.4">
  <!-- We use a custom world for the rrbot so that the camera angle is launched correctly -->

  <world name="default">
    <!--include>
      <uri>model://willowgarage</uri>
    </include-->

    <include>
      <uri>model://ground_plane</uri>
    </include>

    <!-- Global light source -->
    <include>
      <uri>model://sun</uri>
    </include>

    <actor name="actor1">
    <pose>0 1 1.25 0 0 0</pose>
    <skin>
      <filename>moonwalk.dae</filename>
      <scale>1.0</scale>
    </skin>
    <animation name="walking">
      <filename>walk.dae</filename>
      <scale>1.000000</scale>
      <interpolate_x>true</interpolate_x>
    </animation>

      <!-- <script>
        <trajectory id="0" type="walking">
          <waypoint>
            <time>0</time>
            <pose>0 2 0 0 0 -1.57</pose>
          </waypoint>
          <waypoint>
            <time>2</time>
            <pose>0 -2 0 0 0 -1.57</pose>
          </waypoint>
          <waypoint>
            <time>2.5</time>
            <pose>0 -2 0 0 0 1.57</pose>
          </waypoint>
          <waypoint>
            <time>7</time>
            <pose>0 2 0 0 0 1.57</pose>
          </waypoint>
          <waypoint>
            <time>7.5</time>
            <pose>0 2 0 0 0 -1.57</pose>
          </waypoint>
        </trajectory>
      </script> -->

    <plugin name="actor1_plugin" filename="libActorPlugin.so">
    </plugin>

    <plugin name="actor_collisions_plugin" filename="libActorCollisionsPlugin.so">
      <scaling collision="LHipJoint_LeftUpLeg_collision" scale="
        0.01
        0.001
        0.001
      "/>
      <scaling collision="LeftUpLeg_LeftLeg_collision" scale="
        8.0
        8.0
        1.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="LeftLeg_LeftFoot_collision" scale="
        8.0
        8.0
        1.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="LeftFoot_LeftToeBase_collision" scale="
        4.0
        4.0
        1.5
      "/>
      <scaling collision="RHipJoint_RightUpLeg_collision" scale="
        0.01
        0.001
        0.001
      "/>
      <scaling collision="RightUpLeg_RightLeg_collision" scale="
        8.0
        8.0
        1.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="RightLeg_RightFoot_collision" scale="
        8.0
        8.0
        1.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="RightFoot_RightToeBase_collision" scale="
        4.0
        4.0
        1.5
      "/>
      <scaling collision="LowerBack_Spine_collision" scale="
        12.0
        20.0
        5.0
      " pose="0.05 0 0 0 -0.2 0"/>
      <scaling collision="Spine_Spine1_collision" scale="
        0.01
        0.001
        0.001
      "/>
      <scaling collision="Neck_Neck1_collision" scale="
        0.01
        0.001
        0.001
      "/>
      <scaling collision="Neck1_Head_collision" scale="
        5.0
        5.0
        3.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="LeftShoulder_LeftArm_collision" scale="
        0.01
        0.001
        0.001
      "/>
      <scaling collision="LeftArm_LeftForeArm_collision" scale="
        5.0
        5.0
        1.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="LeftForeArm_LeftHand_collision" scale="
        5.0
        5.0
        1.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="LeftFingerBase_LeftHandIndex1_collision" scale="
        4.0
        4.0
        3.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="RightShoulder_RightArm_collision" scale="
        0.01
        0.001
        0.001
      "/>
      <scaling collision="RightArm_RightForeArm_collision" scale="
        5.0
        5.0
        1.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="RightForeArm_RightHand_collision" scale="
        5.0
        5.0
        1.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="RightFingerBase_RightHandIndex1_collision" scale="
        4.0
        4.0
        3.0
      "/>
    </plugin>

    </actor>

  </world>
</sdf>
```

After these modifications, simply $**roslaunch mybot\_gazebo mybot\_world.launch**

To mimic the [Issue #2433](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2433/actor-collisions-example-doesnt-work-with), simply uncomment out the <script> tag and comment out the ActorPlugin xml tag to not utilise the ActorPlugin. 

Clear observation can be made from the laser visualization that despite the collision boxes of the Actor is attached to the Actor itself visually, the Lidar still sees the collision boxes of the Actor at the origin. This is a bug that is very implicit and will not be known unless an extra laser sensor was used.  

Hope this clarifies the testing procedures.
content.html:
For your information, I did my testing on ROS Kinetic with Ubuntu 16.04. I came across this issue when I’m using gazebo with a simulated ROS robot that is equipped with Lidar.

Basically, simply clone this github repo to have a simulated robot.

Note please modify this file mybot_ws/src/mybot_description/urdf/mybot.gazebo. CPU laser must be used since GPU laser is found to be detecting the rendering only instead of the collision boxes.

  • from

    • <sensor type="gpu_ray" name="head_hokuyo_sensor"> to
    • <sensor type="ray" name="head_hokuyo_sensor">

  • from

    • <plugin name="gazebo_ros_head_hokuyo_controller" filename="libgazebo_ros_gpu_laser.so"> to
    • <plugin name="gazebo_ros_head_hokuyo_controller" filename="libgazebo_ros_laser.so">

  • Replace the following code block into the mybot_ws/src/mybot_gazebo/worlds/turtlebot_playground.world.

<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<sdf version="1.4">
  <!-- We use a custom world for the rrbot so that the camera angle is launched correctly -->

  <world name="default">
    <!--include>
      <uri>model://willowgarage</uri>
    </include-->

    <include>
      <uri>model://ground_plane</uri>
    </include>

    <!-- Global light source -->
    <include>
      <uri>model://sun</uri>
    </include>

    <actor name="actor1">
    <pose>0 1 1.25 0 0 0</pose>
    <skin>
      <filename>moonwalk.dae</filename>
      <scale>1.0</scale>
    </skin>
    <animation name="walking">
      <filename>walk.dae</filename>
      <scale>1.000000</scale>
      <interpolate_x>true</interpolate_x>
    </animation>

      <!-- <script>
        <trajectory id="0" type="walking">
          <waypoint>
            <time>0</time>
            <pose>0 2 0 0 0 -1.57</pose>
          </waypoint>
          <waypoint>
            <time>2</time>
            <pose>0 -2 0 0 0 -1.57</pose>
          </waypoint>
          <waypoint>
            <time>2.5</time>
            <pose>0 -2 0 0 0 1.57</pose>
          </waypoint>
          <waypoint>
            <time>7</time>
            <pose>0 2 0 0 0 1.57</pose>
          </waypoint>
          <waypoint>
            <time>7.5</time>
            <pose>0 2 0 0 0 -1.57</pose>
          </waypoint>
        </trajectory>
      </script> -->

    <plugin name="actor1_plugin" filename="libActorPlugin.so">
    </plugin>

    <plugin name="actor_collisions_plugin" filename="libActorCollisionsPlugin.so">
      <scaling collision="LHipJoint_LeftUpLeg_collision" scale="
        0.01
        0.001
        0.001
      "/>
      <scaling collision="LeftUpLeg_LeftLeg_collision" scale="
        8.0
        8.0
        1.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="LeftLeg_LeftFoot_collision" scale="
        8.0
        8.0
        1.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="LeftFoot_LeftToeBase_collision" scale="
        4.0
        4.0
        1.5
      "/>
      <scaling collision="RHipJoint_RightUpLeg_collision" scale="
        0.01
        0.001
        0.001
      "/>
      <scaling collision="RightUpLeg_RightLeg_collision" scale="
        8.0
        8.0
        1.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="RightLeg_RightFoot_collision" scale="
        8.0
        8.0
        1.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="RightFoot_RightToeBase_collision" scale="
        4.0
        4.0
        1.5
      "/>
      <scaling collision="LowerBack_Spine_collision" scale="
        12.0
        20.0
        5.0
      " pose="0.05 0 0 0 -0.2 0"/>
      <scaling collision="Spine_Spine1_collision" scale="
        0.01
        0.001
        0.001
      "/>
      <scaling collision="Neck_Neck1_collision" scale="
        0.01
        0.001
        0.001
      "/>
      <scaling collision="Neck1_Head_collision" scale="
        5.0
        5.0
        3.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="LeftShoulder_LeftArm_collision" scale="
        0.01
        0.001
        0.001
      "/>
      <scaling collision="LeftArm_LeftForeArm_collision" scale="
        5.0
        5.0
        1.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="LeftForeArm_LeftHand_collision" scale="
        5.0
        5.0
        1.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="LeftFingerBase_LeftHandIndex1_collision" scale="
        4.0
        4.0
        3.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="RightShoulder_RightArm_collision" scale="
        0.01
        0.001
        0.001
      "/>
      <scaling collision="RightArm_RightForeArm_collision" scale="
        5.0
        5.0
        1.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="RightForeArm_RightHand_collision" scale="
        5.0
        5.0
        1.0
      "/>
      <scaling collision="RightFingerBase_RightHandIndex1_collision" scale="
        4.0
        4.0
        3.0
      "/>
    </plugin>

    </actor>

  </world>
</sdf>

After these modifications, simply $roslaunch mybot_gazebo mybot_world.launch

To mimic the Issue #2433, simply uncomment out the <script> tag and comment out the ActorPlugin xml tag to not utilise the ActorPlugin.

Clear observation can be made from the laser visualization that despite the collision boxes of the Actor is attached to the Actor itself visually, the Lidar still sees the collision boxes of the Actor at the origin. This is a bug that is very implicit and will not be known unless an extra laser sensor was used.

Hope this clarifies the testing procedures.

pullrequest.title: fix a bug in Actor.cc when using ActorPlugin where the collision remains at the origin

content.raw:
Thank you for the fix! This works for me! I checked that it doesn't adversely affect scripted actors, and fixes actors with custom trajectories. Here's an example of a before and after using `ActorCollisionsPlugin` for one of the actors in `cafe.world`:

## Before, collisions show but are not really there

![actor_traj_no_collision_opt.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2819751335-actor_traj_no_collision_opt.gif)

## With this PR, collisions actually move with the actor

![actor_traj_collision_opt.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/645441980-actor_traj_collision_opt.gif)
content.html:
Thank you for the fix! This works for me! I checked that it doesn't adversely affect scripted actors, and fixes actors with custom trajectories. Here's an example of a before and after using ActorCollisionsPlugin for one of the actors in cafe.world:

Before, collisions show but are not really there

With this PR, collisions actually move with the actor
